question_stem: If a patient develops localized edema, how will this affect the rate of underlying inflammatory conditions?
Suppose a patient experiences an increase in anxiety levels. How will this affect the rate of laryngospasm?
Suppose a patient experiences an increase in nasal congestion and facial pain. How will this affect the rate of Allergic sinusitis?
Suppose a patient experiences a sudden drop in blood pressure. How will this affect the probability of Anaphylaxis?
If a patient experiences an increase in the frequency of heartburn episodes, how will this affect the rate of GERD?
If a patient with Possible NSTEMI / STEMI experiences a significant decrease in chest pain, how will this affect the probability of them having an actual myocardial infarction?
Suppose a patient experiences an increase in joint pain and swelling. How will this affect the probability of them having SLE?
Suppose a patient with Myasthenia gravis experiences an increase in stress levels. How will this affect the severity of their Myasthenia gravis symptoms?
If a patient with stable angina experiences an increase in their stress levels, how will this affect the rate of stable angina episodes?
If a patient experiences an increase in the frequency of PSVT episodes, how will this affect the probability of developing heart failure?
If a patient's ear pain associated with acute otitis media intensifies significantly, how will this affect the probability of developing complications like mastoiditis?
If a patient experiences worsening gastrointestinal symptoms after consuming suspect fish, how will this affect the rate of Scombroid food poisoning?
Suppose a patient presents with increasing difficulty swallowing and drooling. How will this affect the rate of Epiglottitis?
Suppose a patient develops osteoporosis. How will this affect the rate of spontaneous rib fracture?
Suppose a patient develops sudden shortness of breath and chest pain. How will this affect the probability of Pulmonary embolism?
Suppose a patient with Influenza develops shortness of breath. How will this affect the probability of developing pneumonia?
Suppose a patient with whooping cough develops severe breathing difficulties. How will this affect the rate of complications from whooping cough?
If a patient experiences an increase in the severity of their acute dystonic reactions, how will this affect the probability of them requiring treatment with anticholinergic medications?
If a patient experiences worsening chest pain associated with pericarditis, how will this affect the rate of pericarditis?
Suppose a patient with spontaneous pneumothorax develops acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). How will this affect the rate of spontaneous pneumothorax resolution?
Suppose a patient with bronchiolitis develops wheezing. How will this affect the rate of bronchiolitis?
Suppose a patient with Bronchiectasis develops a severe bacterial infection. How will this affect the rate of exacerbations?
Suppose a patient experiences an increase in the frequency and intensity of their panic attacks. How will this affect the probability of developing generalized anxiety disorder?
Suppose a patient develops severe hypertension. How will this affect the rate of Acute pulmonary edema?

If a patient experiences an increase in the frequency and severity of their bronchospasm / acute asthma exacerbation episodes, how will this affect the probability of developing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)?
Suppose a patient infected with Ebola develops severe gastrointestinal bleeding. How will this affect the probability of survival?
If a patient with unstable angina experiences an increase in chest pain frequency and intensity, how will this affect the likelihood of a cardiac event?
Suppose a patient with Chagas disease develops heart failure. How will this affect the rate of progression to chronic Chagas cardiomyopathy?
Suppose a patient with myocarditis develops shortness of breath. How will this affect the rate of myocarditis?
Suppose a patient with Chronic rhinosinusitis develops a severe bacterial infection. How will this affect the rate of Chronic rhinosinusitis?
Suppose a patient with Sarcoidosis experiences an increase in shortness of breath. How will this affect the probability of developing pulmonary fibrosis?
If a patient experiences an Acute COPD exacerbation / infection and their oxygen saturation drops below 90%, how will this affect the probability of hospitalization?
If a patient's persistent cough worsens and they begin coughing up blood, how will this affect the rate of pulmonary neoplasm?
Suppose a patient experiences progressive muscle weakness and paralysis consistent with Guillain-Barré syndrome. How will this affect the probability of developing respiratory failure?
Suppose a patient's chest X-ray reveals increased consolidation in the lungs. How will this affect the pneumonia rate?
Suppose a patient's pancreatic neoplasm is found to be larger than initially diagnosed. How will this affect the probability of metastasis?
If a patient experiences worsening chest pain and vomiting after a forceful bout of retching, how will this affect the probability of Boerhaave syndrome?
Suppose a patient with latent Tuberculosis develops symptoms of active disease. How will this affect the rate of Tuberculosis transmission?
If a patient's URTI symptoms worsen and they develop difficulty breathing, how will this affect the probability of developing pneumonia?
Suppose a patient presents with symptoms of HIV (initial infection) and develops opportunistic pneumonia. How will this affect the rate of progression to AIDS?
Suppose a patient's cough becomes more productive with thicker mucus. How will this affect the rate of Bronchitis?
Suppose a patient's hemoglobin levels drop significantly below the normal range. How will this affect the rate of Anemia?
Suppose a patient experiences an increase in abdominal pressure due to strenuous lifting. How will this affect the rate of inguinal hernia?
Suppose a patient with acute laryngitis develops hoarseness that worsens significantly. How will this affect the rate of acute laryngitis?
If a patient's stridor worsens significantly, how will this affect the likelihood of them having Croup?

Suppose a patient experiences an increase in the frequency and intensity of their cluster headaches. How will this affect the probability of them being diagnosed with cluster headache?
Suppose a patient with viral pharyngitis develops swollen lymph nodes in the neck. How will this affect the rate of complications from viral pharyngitis?
